issue.title: [CF 227] Unit role condition
issue.body:
One thing ive been wondering on, if its possible to make an icon for, which would be useful for DPSers.

What Im envisioning is the possibility to make an icon that shows a shield icon if your current target is attacking the one set with the tank role and showing a danger sign if not not attacking a tank.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras | Imported from CurseForge issue #227 | Raw

comments.body:
It's also useful when a healer in 5 man dungeon need to check maintank's DefensiveBuff /etc (unit "maintank" not work in party.)

By the way, GetRaidTargetIndex("Unit") is useful for PVE too.(With DBM or any boss encounter addons)

Edited Jun 10, 2011

> Posted by CurseForge user lsjyzjl

How does the condition to work?
Unit = Role ?
make a icon like

type:buff/debuff
spell:DefensiveBuff
unit:party1-4
condition:party1=tank or party2=tank or party3=tank or party4=tank.
I think this will make the icon show all party1-4 member's DefensiveBuff.

Or it's a unit condition. looks like i entered unit is party1-4, if partyX=tank, the icon only show partyX's buff, won't show other party member's buff.

Your example:
Type:condition icon
Condtion:targettarget=tank
-.-this icon is work so well, but my icon won't work, i think need use Meta Icon to merge 4 icon to check DefensiveBuff, but it's still a good news for healers.
